title: BTS Drabble Series: Travelling Together
body:
Pairing: BTS x Reader

Genre: fluff, romance, maybe a little angst

Warnings: slight mention of physical violence, stalking

Word Count: 3095 for all 7 drabbles

A/N: I don’t know if I can call this a reaction or scenario because boy am I wordy! But I really like doing stories like this and hope to post more. And my request box is open!

SEOKJIN

“How is it that someone as smart as you is so bad at directions?”

“Ya! What is that supposed to mean?”

With a raised eyebrow, you looked up at your boyfriend from where you were sat on the street curb. For the last ten minutes he had been mumbling to himself as he tried to figure out exactly where you were, and how to get back to where you were supposed to be. His phone dead, yours accidently left at the hotel, and in a country that neither of you spoke the language, you were essentially helpless.

Not that you minded being lost; going off the beaten was sometimes the best way to see a new place and you knew you’d eventually find the way back. But when you’re supposed to be meeting the others for dinner and had no way to contact them, well, that threw a wrench into the situation.

You huffed, finding it hard to be mad when he looked so cute. Finally you stood up, wiping the dirt off your pants and holding out your hand. “Come on.”

Taking your hand without question, Jin allowed you to lead him down the street. “But how do you know this is the right way?” he pouted.

You smiled over your shoulder at him. “I don’t. But just sitting there isn’t going to get us anywhere.”

Hand in hand, you strolled down the cobbled streets, content in each other’s company and enjoying the quiet buzz of the city.

As the shadows grew long along the streets, you finally reached the seaside promenade, just as the sun was dipping below the horizon. You gasped in delight as the sky was set ablaze with fiery oranges and reds as the sun sunk melted into the dark ocean.

Strong arms circled your waist, and you leaned back into the embrace. Jin pressed a kiss into your before leaning his head against yours, savoring the moment.

If every day ended like this, in a beautiful city with a beautiful girl in his arms, he would get lost a thousand times over.

 YOONGI

It was no secret that Yoongi’s least favorite part of travelling was having to go through the loud and sometimes pushy throng of fans when entering and leaving the airport. Some times were better than others, but every time he would be on edge until it was over. But this time was different than all the others, because for the first time you were travelling with the members as they set off on the next leg of their tour instead of meeting them in the first city.

You relationship had been public for several months, but as you both valued your privacy, you still kept your public appearances to a minimum. That meant that Yoongi didn’t know how the fans would react, which made him more nervous than usual.

As they prepared to exit the SUV that had brought them to the airport, Yoongi looked over at you. “No matter what, just keep walking and never let go of my hand, okay?”

You nodded, leaning over to press a quick kiss to his lips. “I’ll never let go, Jack.”

You smiled in triumph as his shoulders dropped slightly, some of the tension leaving his body at your corny line.

He nodded to Namjoon and Jungkook who were seated in the row ahead of them that they were ready to go, and taking your hand, pulled you out of the car.

Your steps stuttered, momentarily stunned at the cacophony of noise and blinding flashes. You could see the company’s security team on either side as you walked, but that didn’t stop you from being jostled as some brave fans tried to rush them in order to get closer to the members. But as promised, you held Yoongi’s hand and followed his lead.

On the other side of airport security, you finally released a breath you didn’t realize you had been holding. Yoongi turned around, eyes scanned up and down your body. “Okay?”

“Okay.”

He pulled you against his chest, holding you tight as he pressed a kiss to your temple. “Okay.”

 HOSEOK

Today was no different. You had flown out to be with the group for the last two cities on the European leg of the tour, and now you were all on the way back to Korea. After having been gone for the last three months, management had told you to expect a big crowd at Incheon.

Hoseok’s vicelike grip on your singular focus as he pulled you behind him, your joined hands held at the small of his back. You were suddenly yanked backward, a shocked gasp escaping as you hit the ground. Fingernails dig into your skin, sinking deep when you tried to yank your arm out of their grasp.

“Leave J-Hope. Leave him alone. He’s mine.”

You looked around, eyes filling with tears. “Please, let go. You’re hurting me.”

“Leave him. Do you hear me?” You screamed as she yanked your head, you neck painfully snapping back at the motion.

“Hands. Off,” a deep voice growled from above you.

As the crazed fan reach for Hoseok, screaming his name, security finally got to you, roughly pushing the girl away.

He pushed you up to the open door of the SUV, thankful to see Yoongi’s arm each out to help you into the car. He quickly followed you, wasting no time in taking you back into his arms.

“Hobi hyung, what happened back there?” Jimin’s quiet voice asked from the seats behind them, his hand reaching up to rest gently on the top of your head.

“Someone from the crowd got throw security and knocked her down.”

“Oh, Y/N-noona,” Taehyung whispered from beside Jimin.

Hoseok’s heart clenched feeling you shake in his arms. He don’t know what went wrong but he vowed that nothing like that would ever happen again, not as long he had something to say about it.

NAMJOON

Laying on your stomach, head resting on folded arms, you watched with a fond smile as your overgrown kid of a boyfriend waded around in the tidal pools closer to the water’s edge. A weekend at the beach, a weekend to recharge and refill his creative well.

You knew this was a big deal, for several different reasons, but you couldn’t help but worry that he was going overboard.

Meanwhile, sprawled out in the reclined seat next to yours, your boyfriend slept, dead to the world. Even though you were slightly jealous, you couldn’t help but smile fondly at the man beside you. In his sleep, Jungkook looked even more like a baby boy, something you loved to tease him about.

Namjoon was writing in his notebook, head bobbing to whatever beat he was listening to through his headphones. Hoseok and Jimin were each on their phones but looked up when they noticed you standing, silent glances asking if everything was okay. You smiled at them, assuring them you were fine, miming that you were getting a drink, asking if they wanted one.

Carefully stepping over Jungkook’s legs, you made your way toward the front of the plane, asking one of the flight attendants for a Coke. You chatted with them while you sipped your drink, always find their travel stories fascinating.

Your first instinct was to grab the cellphone and bang it over the head of however was violating Jungkook’s privacy. But your second instinct, the one you followed, had you striding forward, stopping in front the offending cellphone.

The owner looked up, eyes wide when she realized who you were. You knew who, or rather what, she was. She tried to put the phone back in her bag but you reached out, clamping a hand around her wrist. You leaned forward, voice low and menacing. “I see this playing out one of two ways. One, you willing give me your phone and don’t make a fuss when security comes over. Or two, you willing give me your phone and don’t make a fuss when security comes over.” You watch as she shakily retrieves the phone and drops into your waiting hand.

Schooling your features to not worry the members who were awake, you find the head of security and inform him of what happened. Only once they move into the next section do you breathe a sigh of relief and sink back into your seat.

Jungkook stirred besides you. “You okay, babe?” he asks, voice still gravelling with sleep.

“Better now,” you answer, reaching over to smooth back his hair, hand resting on his cheek. “Go back to sleep, Kookie, we’ve got a few more hours before landing.”

He nods sleepily, taking your hand and pressing a kiss to the back of it before almost immediately falling back to sleep.

You know he would find out soon enough, but for now, you were happy to let him sleep in peace.

You huffed, finding it hard to be mad when he looked so cute. Finally you stood up, wiping the dirt off your pants and holding out your hand. “Come on.”

You smiled over your shoulder at him. “I don’t. But just sitting there isn’t going to get us anywhere.”

Hand in hand, you strolled down the cobbled streets, content in each other’s company and enjoying the quiet buzz of the city.

As the shadows grew long along the streets, you finally reached the seaside promenade, just as the sun was dipping below the horizon. You gasped in delight as the sky was set ablaze with fiery oranges and reds as the sun sunk melted into the dark ocean.

Strong arms circled your waist, and you leaned back into the embrace. Jin pressed a kiss into your before leaning his head against yours, savoring the moment.

If every day ended like this, in a beautiful city with a beautiful girl in his arms, he would get lost a thousand times over.

 YOONGI

It was no secret that Yoongi’s least favorite part of travelling was having to go through the loud and sometimes pushy throng of fans when entering and leaving the airport. Some times were better than others, but every time he would be on edge until it was over. But this time was different than all the others, because for the first time you were travelling with the members as they set off on the next leg of their tour instead of meeting them in the first city.

You relationship had been public for several months, but as you both valued your privacy, you still kept your public appearances to a minimum. That meant that Yoongi didn’t know how the fans would react, which made him more nervous than usual.

As they prepared to exit the SUV that had brought them to the airport, Yoongi looked over at you. “No matter what, just keep walking and never let go of my hand, okay?”

You nodded, leaning over to press a quick kiss to his lips. “I’ll never let go, Jack.”

You smiled in triumph as his shoulders dropped slightly, some of the tension leaving his body at your corny line.

He nodded to Namjoon and Jungkook who were seated in the row ahead of them that they were ready to go, and taking your hand, pulled you out of the car.

Your steps stuttered, momentarily stunned at the cacophony of noise and blinding flashes. You could see the company’s security team on either side as you walked, but that didn’t stop you from being jostled as some brave fans tried to rush them in order to get closer to the members. But as promised, you held Yoongi’s hand and followed his lead.

On the other side of airport security, you finally released a breath you didn’t realize you had been holding. Yoongi turned around, eyes scanned up and down your body. “Okay?”

“Okay.”

He pulled you against his chest, holding you tight as he pressed a kiss to your temple. “Okay.”

 HOSEOK

It was no secret that Hoseok was the most fiercely protective member of BTS. It didn’t matter if you were his hyung or dongsaeng, if you were in need, he was there. It therefore was no surprise that that went tenfold for you, his girlfriend. From the beginning, Hoseok had not wanted to hide your relationship. As soon as knew that what you had together was more than a fling, he went to management and informed them of his intentions of revealing that you were dating. They wouldn’t stop him but made sure that both he, and you, understood the potential consequences.

You were slowly becoming accustomed to near constant flash of lights and screams of fans anytime you stepped out in public with Hoseok. It was jarring, and you don’t know that you’d ever be fully used to it, but you were learning how to handle the attention.

Today was no different. You had flown out to be with the group for the last two cities on the European leg of the tour, and now you were all on the way back to Korea. After having been gone for the last three months, management had told you to expect a big crowd at Incheon.

Hoseok’s vicelike grip on your singular focus as he pulled you behind him, your joined hands held at the small of his back. You were suddenly yanked backward, a shocked gasp escaping as you hit the ground. Fingernails dig into your skin, sinking deep when you tried to yank your arm out of their grasp.

“Leave J-Hope. Leave him alone. He’s mine.”

You looked around, eyes filling with tears. “Please, let go. You’re hurting me.”

“Leave him. Do you hear me?” You screamed as she yanked your head, you neck painfully snapping back at the motion.

“Hands. Off,” a deep voice growled from above you.

Even as the tears spilled, relief flooded your body at the sight of your boyfriend standing over you.

As the crazed fan reach for Hoseok, screaming his name, security finally got to you, roughly pushing the girl away.

“Hey, hey,” Hoseok said, his voice soft as he reached down, gently pulled you up and into his chest. “I’ve got you know. I’m so sorry, baby, so so sorry.”

Tucking you his side and using his arm to cover your head, a steely faced Hoseok led you the rest of the way out of the airport.

He pushed you up to the open door of the SUV, thankful to see Yoongi’s arm each out to help you into the car. He quickly followed you, wasting no time in taking you back into his arms.

“Hobi hyung, what happened back there?” Jimin’s quiet voice asked from the seats behind them, his hand reaching up to rest gently on the top of your head.

“Someone from the crowd got throw security and knocked her down.”

“Oh, Y/N-noona,” Taehyung whispered from beside Jimin.

Hoseok’s heart clenched feeling you shake in his arms. He don’t know what went wrong but he vowed that nothing like that would ever happen again, not as long he had something to say about it.

NAMJOON

Laying on your stomach, head resting on folded arms, you watched with a fond smile as your overgrown kid of a boyfriend waded around in the tidal pools closer to the water’s edge. A weekend at the beach, a weekend to recharge and refill his creative well.

You weren’t entirely sure how searching for crabs helped with that, but you definitely weren’t going to stop him. You were just thankful that he was getting a break, knowing how much work he was putting into the latest comeback. You rarely saw each other in daylight hours, often only exchanging a few words and tired kisses as one or the other of you slipped in or out of your shared bed. You weren’t complaining, it came with the territory of being a relationship with an idol, but having him all to yourself for the next 48 hours felt amazing.

“Joon!” you called.

You rolled over to your back, closing your eyes against the bright sun.

“Hey beautiful,” Namjoon hummed as he crawled up your body. Holding himself up on his forearms, he dipped down, capturing your lips with his own. “You lonely up here all by yourself?” He nipped at your bottom lip, a cocky smirk playing against his own.

You playfully smacked his chest. “Oh my god that was so cringey.”

“What can I say, in that swimsuit you bring out the fuckboy in me.”

Snaking your arms around his neck, you pulled him in for another kiss. “Also cringey. But I’m glad you like it. But right now I want you to take a nap with me.”

“Aish, is that all I am to you, a glorified pillow?”

“Not at all,” you said, poking his cheek. “You’re my insanely talented, unbelievably attractive, wonderfully devoted love my life, who just also happens to be the perfect cuddle buddy.”

“Well, when you put in like that.”

Namjoon rolled onto his side that you were facing each other, opening his arms, and you wasted no time in tucking yourself under his chin. His hands gently stroked up and down your back.

“Thanks for coming with me.”

“I couldn’t imagine being anywhere else.”

The warm air tangy with salt from the ocean breeze, the sounds of waves gently lapping against the shore- it didn’t take long from your breathing. Wrapped in the arms of the person who made you feel so loved and safe. You don’t remember the last time you felt this content, and you truly hoped Namjoon felt the same.

JIMIN

Success was a double-edged sword. At the same time that Jimin and his brothers worked hard to achieve their dreams, reaching milestones and breaking records in the process, it also became harder and harder to just be themselves. With success came recognition, and with recognition came the nearly impossible task of going out in public with ease.

It was something that Jimin was used to by this point, but he knew it was still hard for you. Your life had changed the moment you agreed to go out on a first date with him but you had no regrets. Even though the relationship was still new, you couldn’t imagine your life without Jimin in it.

Your birthday was coming up, and he wanted to do something special for you, something where you wouldn’t have to worry about cameras or prying eyes. That’s when he remembered the new hot springs resort with rave reviews; it was perfect for a weekend getaway. Jimin was nervous, this was a first in your relationship, but seeing your eyes light up as you approached the resort made all his worries melt away.

Later than evening, a blissful sigh escaped your lips as slid deeper into the steaming water. “Oh my god,” you moaned. “Is this what heaven feels like?”

Beside you, Jimin hummed in agreement. Glancing over, your breath caught in your throat. In the soft moonlight, your boyfriend looked absolutely ethereal; eyes closed, head tilted back to rest against the edge of the spring, he could be a nymph out of an old fairytale. Not for the first time, you found yourself stunned with the knowledge that he was yours.

Jimin cracked an eye open when he heard you moving, water rippling with your movement as you came to straddle his hips. Hands instinctively went to your waist as he lifted his head up, drinking in the sight of you.

Your hands gently carded through his hair, brushing the damp locks back as you dipped down to kiss him, slow and sweet. You leaned your forehead against his. “I love you,” you whispered, lips ghosting over his.

“I love you too, so much.” He reached up, hands gentle as he cupped your face. “I want this to last forever.”

You barely had time to take another breath before Jimin pulled you down into another kiss, this time full of desperation and need. You were putty in his hands, melting under his every touch, burning up in your love for him.

It was a night of firsts, the first of many, one to always be remembered.

TAEHYUNG

“I’m all for an excuse to buy something new but I think this is a bit much,” you whined at your boyfriend’s back. You sat haphazardly on the chic leather sofa in the middle of the designer boutique as he flitted around the store, the star-struck and slightly panicked sales associate scrambling around behind him to keep up.

“Oh my beautiful darling, you know how important this,” Taehyung answered over his shoulder.

“The clothes we have are more than fine. I mean, you picked most of them out, for both of us,” you laughed.

“This is different though.” He pulled out a dress, holding up it for your inspection. You shrugged indifferently, and after a second look, he handed to the nearest associate. “Need to see it on,” he muttered.

In just over a week the two of you were travelling to Paris for Fashion Week. You had thought your boyfriend was going to have a stroke when he learned the news from his manager. As someone who loved fashion as much as Taehyung did, it was like a dream come true. You couldn’t remember the last time you’d seen him this excited yet anxious. You knew this was a big deal, for several different reasons, but you couldn’t help but worry that he was going overboard.

With a sigh, you got up from the sofa, motioning for a moment alone and smiling thankfully as the sales associate left, bowing to you as they took their armfuls of clothing to the dressing room.

You wrapped your arms around Taehyung’s waist, resting you cheek on his back. “You’ve already been invited, Tae,” you told him. “You’ve already impressed whoever it is that decides who gets an invite and who doesn’t. All you need to do is show up and be your utterly amazing self. They won’t know what hit them.”

You heard him sigh before finally relaxing under your touch. You loosened your arms as he turned, wrapping his own around your shoulders and pulling you to his chest.

“I know,” he answered, chin rested on top of your head. “I don’t know. I don’t know why I want their validation. It’s just fashion. It sounds so stupid now that I say it out loud.”

You leaned back, looking up into his face. “Hey. It’s not stupid. It’s human nature to seek validation. You’ve worked hard to hone your fashion and craft your image, it’s only natural to want that hard work to be recognized, especially when it’s by people you admire.”

“Thank you. For understanding,” he whispered, leaning down to kiss the tip of your nose.

And the next week, after you saw the photos and magazine articles featuring Taehyung, and even a few with yourself, you knew that the newest additions to your already overflowing closet were completely worth it.

 JUNGKOOK

Even though you knew it was a survival mechanism brought on by idol life, of snatching precious moments of rest whenever you could, one of the many things you admired about Jungkook was his ability to fall asleep almost anywhere, at any time.

Halfway through the long flight and you hadn’t been able to do more than edit some pictures and videos on your laptop. Meanwhile, sprawled out in the reclined seat next to yours, your boyfriend slept, dead to the world. Even though you were slightly jealous, you couldn’t help but smile fondly at the man beside you. In his sleep, Jungkook looked even more like a baby boy, something you loved to tease him about.

With a sigh, you stretched your arms overhead, groaning with satisfaction as the motion pulled at the tight muscles in your back. You stood, glancing at the seats behind you where the other members were sat. Taehyung, Yoongi, and Jin were also asleep. Namjoon was writing in his notebook, head bobbing to whatever beat he was listening to through his headphones. Hoseok and Jimin were each on their phones but looked up when they noticed you standing, silent glances asking if everything was okay. You smiled at them, assuring them you were fine, miming that you were getting a drink, asking if they wanted one.

Carefully stepping over Jungkook’s legs, you made your way toward the front of the plane, asking one of the flight attendants for a Coke. You chatted with them while you sipped your drink, always find their travel stories fascinating.

As you made your way back to your seat, you saw something that made you stop, your blood running cold- the unmistakable sight of a cellphone angled towards your sleeping boyfriend. Your first instinct was to grab the cellphone and bang it over the head of however was violating Jungkook’s privacy. But your second instinct, the one you followed, had you striding forward, stopping in front the offending cellphone.

The owner looked up, eyes wide when she realized who you were. You knew who, or rather what, she was. She tried to put the phone back in her bag but you reached out, clamping a hand around her wrist. You leaned forward, voice low and menacing. “I see this playing out one of two ways. One, you willing give me your phone and don’t make a fuss when security comes over. Or two, you willing give me your phone and don’t make a fuss when security comes over.” You watch as she shakily retrieves the phone and drops into your waiting hand.

Schooling your features to not worry the members who were awake, you find the head of security and inform him of what happened. Only once they move into the next section do you breathe a sigh of relief and sink back into your seat.

Jungkook stirred besides you. “You okay, babe?” he asks, voice still gravelling with sleep.

“Better now,” you answer, reaching over to smooth back his hair, hand resting on his cheek. “Go back to sleep, Kookie, we’ve got a few more hours before landing.”

He nods sleepily, taking your hand and pressing a kiss to the back of it before almost immediately falling back to sleep.

You know he would find out soon enough, but for now, you were happy to let him sleep in peace.

Or two, you willing give me your phone and don’t make a fuss when security comes over.” You watch as she shakily retrieves the phone and drops into your waiting hand.

Schooling your features to not worry the members who were awake, you find the head of security and inform him of what happened. Only once they move into the next section do you breathe a sigh of relief and sink back into your seat.

Jungkook stirred besides you. “You okay, babe?” he asks, voice still gravelling with sleep.

“Better now,” you answer, reaching over to smooth back his hair, hand resting on his cheek. “Go back to sleep, Kookie, we’ve got a few more hours before landing.”

He nods sleepily, taking your hand and pressing a kiss to the back of it before almost immediately falling back to sleep.

You know he would find out soon enough, but for now, you were happy to let him sleep in peace.

Pairing: BTS x Reader

Genre: fluff, romance, maybe a little angst

Warnings: slight mention of physical violence, stalking

Word Count: 3095 for all 7 drabbles

summary: [INTERVISTA] La proprietaria del ‘ristorante dei BTS’ condivide i ricordi che ha dei ragazzi durante il loro periodo da trainee
title: [INTERVISTA] La proprietaria del ‘ristorante dei BTS’ condivide i ricordi che ha dei ragazzi durante il loro periodo da trainee
body:
“I BTS sono diventati tra le popstar più famose della Corea del Sud.

Non è la prima volta che il gruppo raggiunge la cima delle classifiche o fa sold-out ai propri concerti, tuttavia vale la pena dare uno sguardo a quanto lontano i sette ragazzi sono arrivati a partire dal loro debutto nel 2013.

Gli idol del k-pop devono lavorare sodo durante il loro periodo come trainee. Anche i BTS hanno versato ‘sangue e sudore’, stando alle parole di Kang Sun-Ja, 67 anni, proprietaria del ristorante ‘Yoojung Sikdang’ dove i membri dei BTS erano soliti mangiare allo stesso tavolo quasi tutti i giorni per due anni quando ancora erano trainee. Il ristorante parla da sé dal momento che ovunque ci si giri ci sono poster e adesivi.

Siamo stati abbastanza fortunati da riuscire a parlare con Kang, che è una delle poche persone ad essere stata a più stretto contatto con i BTS nei primi tempi della loro carriera.

Questo è quello che ci ha rivelato sui ragazzi.

-DOMANDA- Abbiamo sentito dire che i membri dei BTS venivano in questo ristorante tutti i giorni quando erano trainee. Ci parli dei suoi ricordi di quel periodo.

KANG: “I ragazzi erano molto solari, rispettosi, amichevoli ed educati, insomma, dalle mille qualità. Non sono molti i ragazzi che a quell'età sono così. Ogni volta che ci incontravamo mi salutavano e io avevo l’impressione ci fosse qualcosa di diverso in loro.

Il successo che stanno avendo non è dato semplicemente dalla fortuna ma è frutto del loro sforzo. Hanno davvero versato sangue e sudore nel loro lavoro. A volte pensavo che se i loro genitori li avessero visti [in quello stato], si sarebbero sentiti male per loro. Quando terminavano il loro duro allenamento salivano dallo studio nel seminterrato con magliette e capelli grondanti dal sudore”.

Loro si allenavano ogni giorno dalla mattina alle dieci di sera. Alcune volte continuavano per tutta la notte. Hanno lavorato così duramente.

Penso che ora che hanno raggiunto l’apice i membri dei BTS guardino al loro passato. È raro per delle persone della loro età lavorare così duramente. Molti vogliono giocare, uscire con gli amici. Sa, non è così facile lasciare tutto e focalizzarsi su una cosa sola. E ciò che i sacrifici hanno portato loro è 100 volte meglio.”

-DOMANDA- Se venivano qui ogni giorno il cibo deve essere buono. Mangiavano spesso gli stessi piatti?

KANG: “Sì, mangiavano spesso le stesse cose. Alternavano tra un piatto e l’altro. Preferivano il bibimbap fatto con riso e maiale. Quello poi è diventato il “Bibimbap dei Bangtan”. Per circa due anni e mezzo sono venuti qui a mangiare. All'inizio mangiavano due o tre ciotole di riso prima che la loro compagnia li mettesse a dieta. Yoongi (Suga) era solito mangiare petto di pollo, latte e banana tutto frullato insieme.

A volte gli facevo mangiare i loro cibi preferiti di nascosto e mi ricordo che dicevo loro che dovevano mangiare bene per lavorare a modo. E che non avrebbero preso peso perché si muovevano tanto.”

-DOMANDA- Chi aveva più fascino?

KANG: “Nonostante tutti avessero il loro fascino, direi Jimin.”

-DOMANDA- Le hanno mai chiesto consigli?

KANG: “A volte parlavano. Sono sicura abbiano avuto la loro dose di difficoltà ma sono sempre riusciti a parlarne tra di loro senza litigare. Namjoon (RM) non metteva mai giù il telefono mentre mangiava per migliorarsi studiando gli altri performer e tra me e me pensavo che lui avesse il potenziale per essere un leader, cosa che è diventata poi realtà.

Yoongi era davvero gentile. Si sono adattati tutti ai loro ruoli. Quando dopo un concerto li vedo mentre si abbracciano sul palco con le lacrime agli occhi, mi ritorna in mente quando facevano la stessa cosa da trainee, quando si abbracciavano e si prendevano cura l’uno dell’altro. È davvero toccante.”

-DOMANDA- Si tiene ancora aggiornata sui BTS?

KANG: “Lo faccio. Gli ARMY mi mandano cose, specialmente quando il gruppo tiene un concerto. Gli ARMY sono brave persone. Penso che proprio come i BTS, anche i loro fan siano gentili. Dai ventenni agli ottantenni, le persone di tutte le età mi dicono di ricavare energia dalla musica dei BTS. Parlo spesso con le persone che vengono al ristorante.

Alcuni fan stavano avendo problemi con il loro matrimonio. Mi hanno detto che i testi delle canzoni dei BTS continuavano a toccare loro il cuore sempre più in profondità, il che li ha aiutati a realizzare che c’era qualcosa di sbagliato [nelle loro vite]. E da allora alcuni di loro mi hanno detto di essere stati capaci di ricominciare nuovamente e dare il via ad una nuova vita.

Quando lasci il lavoro, a volte ti senti davvero giù di morale. E alcune persone hanno cominciato a vivere una vita nuova grazie ai BTS. Trovo davvero interessante come così tanti fan, ognuno con la propria storia, siano riusciti ad essere motivati dalla musica dei BTS e a ricominciare di nuovo.”

-DOMANDA- Ascolta i BTS?

KANG: Quella che amo di più tra tutte è “Blood Sweat & Tears”. Il testo mi tocca il cuore e sono sicura che valga lo stesso per loro. Quando il negozio è tranquillo, mi sembra quasi come se in qualsiasi momento potessero aprire la porta entrando e urlando “Imo (N/B: lett. “zia”), abbiamo fame!”.

Nel giorno del debutto vennero qui a mangiare e a fare foto, come hanno riportato i media. Sono felice che il nostro ristorante sia diventato famoso grazie a loro. Io sono solo una ristoratrice, non so se l'abbiano fatto per gratitudine o meno, ma devono aver parlato del locale alla gente, visto che moltissimi clienti sono Army e tanti altri [lo diventano] dopo aver mangiato ”.

-DOMANDA- Quand'è stata l’ultima volta che li ha visti?

KANG: “Non li vedo dal luglio di due anni fa (2017), circa, quando Seokjin venne da solo. Mi mancano. Avranno sempre un posto speciale nel mio cuore. Mi chiedo come stiano, se mangino bene quando sono all'estero. Vorrei che tornassero a farmi visita, davvero, quando vogliono. Mi mancano moltissimo e mi piacerebbe fare qualcosa per loro.

Non dicevo mai di volere loro bene, piuttosto di rimanere in salute e mangiare bene. Se li vedessi ora invece direi che voglio loro bene. Mi ricordo che Yoongi mi disse che quando si sarebbero spostati con gli uffici dell’agenzia, i fan allora sarebbero venuti al ristorante. Io penso piacerebbe loro tornare qui, ma non deve essere facile.  

Sa, io non ho fatto molto. Sono solo una ristoratrice che ha cercato di cucinare il meglio possibile per dei ragazzi che vivevano lontano dai loro genitori. Parlando da madre, mi sono comportata con loro quasi come un genitore.

Sono solo felice che non si siano dimenticati di me”.  

Traduzione a cura di Bangtan Italian Channel Subs (©Cam, ©CiHope, ©lynch, ©jimindipityR) | ©KpopHerald

Sa, non è così facile lasciare tutto e focalizzarsi su una cosa sola. E ciò che i sacrifici hanno portato loro è 100 volte meglio.”

-DOMANDA- Se venivano qui ogni giorno il cibo deve essere buono. Mangiavano spesso gli stessi piatti?

KANG: “Sì, mangiavano spesso le stesse cose. Alternavano tra un piatto e l’altro. Preferivano il bibimbap fatto con riso e maiale. Quello poi è diventato il “Bibimbap dei Bangtan”. Per circa due anni e mezzo sono venuti qui a mangiare. All'inizio mangiavano due o tre ciotole di riso prima che la loro compagnia li mettesse a dieta. Yoongi (Suga) era solito mangiare petto di pollo, latte e banana tutto frullato insieme.

A volte gli facevo mangiare i loro cibi preferiti di nascosto e mi ricordo che dicevo loro che dovevano mangiare bene per lavorare a modo. E che non avrebbero preso peso perché si muovevano tanto.”

-DOMANDA- Chi aveva più fascino?

KANG: “Nonostante tutti avessero il loro fascino, direi Jimin.”

-DOMANDA- Le hanno mai chiesto consigli?

KANG: “A volte parlavano. Sono sicura abbiano avuto la loro dose di difficoltà ma sono sempre riusciti a parlarne tra di loro senza litigare. Namjoon (RM) non metteva mai giù il telefono mentre mangiava per migliorarsi studiando gli altri performer e tra me e me pensavo che lui avesse il potenziale per essere un leader, cosa che è diventata poi realtà.

Yoongi era davvero gentile. Si sono adattati tutti ai loro ruoli. Quando dopo un concerto li vedo mentre si abbracciano sul palco con le lacrime agli occhi, mi ritorna in mente quando facevano la stessa cosa da trainee, quando si abbracciavano e si prendevano cura l’uno dell’altro. È davvero toccante.”

-DOMANDA- Si tiene ancora aggiornata sui BTS?

KANG: “Lo faccio. Gli ARMY mi mandano cose, specialmente quando il gruppo tiene un concerto. Gli ARMY sono brave persone. Penso che proprio come i BTS, anche i loro fan siano gentili. Dai ventenni agli ottantenni, le persone di tutte le età mi dicono di ricavare energia dalla musica dei BTS. Parlo spesso con le persone che vengono al ristorante.

Alcuni fan stavano avendo problemi con il loro matrimonio. Mi hanno detto che i testi delle canzoni dei BTS continuavano a toccare loro il cuore sempre più in profondità, il che li ha aiutati a realizzare che c’era qualcosa di sbagliato [nelle loro vite]. E da allora alcuni di loro mi hanno detto di essere stati capaci di ricominciare nuovamente e dare il via ad una nuova vita.

Quando lasci il lavoro, a volte ti senti davvero giù di morale. E alcune persone hanno cominciato a vivere una vita nuova grazie ai BTS. Trovo davvero interessante come così tanti fan, ognuno con la propria storia, siano riusciti ad essere motivati dalla musica dei BTS e a ricominciare di nuovo.”

-DOMANDA- Ascolta i BTS?

KANG: Quella che amo di più tra tutte è “Blood Sweat & Tears”. Il testo mi tocca il cuore e sono sicura che valga lo stesso per loro. Quando il negozio è tranquillo, mi sembra quasi come se in qualsiasi momento potessero aprire la porta entrando e urlando “Imo (N/B: lett. “zia”), abbiamo fame!”.

Nel giorno del debutto vennero qui a mangiare e a fare foto, come hanno riportato i media. Sono felice che il nostro ristorante sia diventato famoso grazie a loro. Io sono solo una ristoratrice, non so se l'abbiano fatto per gratitudine o meno, ma devono aver parlato del locale alla gente, visto che moltissimi clienti sono Army e tanti altri [lo diventano] dopo aver mangiato ”.

-DOMANDA- Quand'è stata l’ultima volta che li ha visti?

KANG: “Non li vedo dal luglio di due anni fa (2017), circa, quando Seokjin venne da solo. Mi mancano. Avranno sempre un posto speciale nel mio cuore. Mi chiedo come stiano, se mangino bene quando sono all'estero. Vorrei che tornassero a farmi visita, davvero, quando vogliono. Mi mancano moltissimo e mi piacerebbe fare qualcosa per loro.

Non dicevo mai di volere loro bene, piuttosto di rimanere in salute e mangiare bene. Se li vedessi ora invece direi che voglio loro bene. Mi ricordo che Yoongi mi disse che quando si sarebbero spostati con gli uffici dell’agenzia, i fan allora sarebbero venuti al ristorante. Io penso piacerebbe loro tornare qui, ma non deve essere facile.  

Sa, io non ho fatto molto. Sono solo una ristoratrice che ha cercato di cucinare il meglio possibile per dei ragazzi che vivevano lontano dai loro genitori. Parlando da madre, mi sono comportata con loro quasi come un genitore.

Sono solo felice che non si siano dimenticati di me”.
